main.api

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.api.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class of EloApi
    Author:
    Nicolas Mauger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      Constructs a new Player, who never play a game and who have 1000 Elo points by default.
      Player(double elo, int gamesPlayed)
      Constructs a new Player whose Elo rank and and whose number of played games are specified.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player()
        Constructs a new Player, who never play a game and who have 1000 Elo points by default.

      • Player

        public Player(double elo,
              int gamesPlayed)
        Constructs a new Player whose Elo rank and and whose number of played games are specified.
        Parameters:
        elo - Player's Elo points
        gamesPlayed - number of ranked played games

    • Method Detail

      • versus

        public void versus(Player player,
                   int result)
        Play a match between two player. Elo points of these two player will be calculate depending on the result of the match, their previous rank and the development coefficient K. The new Elo rank is given by the formula En+1 = En + K * (result - p(D)) If the player has less than 9 played game, the Elo rank is given by the average of the games played.
        Parameters:
        player - the opponent
        result - value higher than zero for a win, equals to zero for a draw and less than zero for a lose to opponent

      • getElo

        public double getElo()
        Returns the Elo rank of this player in double precision
        Returns:
        the Elo rank of this player

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representing this Player and its values.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representing player's Elo points and the number of games he played.
